intro: Swertia usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
